node.name: FinalNode
node.description: The final node of the program. If the program consists of some parallel execution lines the reachment of this block terminates the corresponding execution line. This block can`t have outgoing links.

node.name: CommentBlock
node.description: This block can hold text notes that are ignored by generators and interpreters. Use it for improving the diagram readability.

node.name: Subprogram
node.description: Subprogram call. Subprograms are used for splitting repetitive program parts into a separate diagram and then calling it from main diagram or other subprograms. When this block is added into a diagram it will be suggested to enter subprogram name. The double click on subprogram call block may open the corresponding subprogram diagram. Moreover user palette will appear containing existing subrpograms, they can be dragged into a diagram like the usial blocks.

node.name: VariableInit
node.description: Assignes a given value to a given variable.

node.name: InitialNode
node.description: The entry point of the program execution. Each diagram should have only one such block, it must not have incomming links and it must have only one outgoing link. The interpretation process starts from exactly this block.

edge.name: ControlFlow
edge.description: For creating a link between two elements A and B you can just hover a mouse above A, press the right mouse button and (without releasing it) draw a line to the element B. Alternatively you can just 'pull' a link from a small blue circle next to the element.

node.name: Loop
node.description: This block executes a sequence of blocks for a given number of times. The number of repetitions is specified by the 'Iterations' parameter. This block must have two outgoing links. One of them must be marked with the 'iteration' guard (that means that the property 'Guard' of the link must be set to 'iteration' value). Another outgoing link must be unmarked: the program execution will be proceeded through this link when it will go through our 'Loop' block for the given number of times.

node.name: Fork
node.description: Separates program execution into a number of threads that will be executed concurrently from the programmers`s point of view. For example in such way signal from sensor and some time interval can be waited synchroniously. This block must have at least two outgoing links.

node.name: Function
node.description: Evaluates a value of the given expression. Also new variables can be defined in this block. See the 'Expressions Syntax' chapter in help for more information about 'Function' block syntax.

node.name: IfBlock
node.description: Separates program execution in correspondece with the given condition. The 'Condition' parameter value must be some boolean expression that will determine subsequent program execution line. This block must have two outgoing links, at least one of them must have 'Guard' parameter set to 'true' or 'false'. The execution will be proceed trough the link marked with the guard corresponding to 'Condition' parameter of the block.

node.name: NxtEnginesBackward
node.description: Enables motors on the given ports in reverse mode with the given power. Ports are specified with A, B or C letters divided by commas. The power is specified in percents with the number from -100 to 100, if negative number is specified then the motor is enabled in the usial mode.

node.name: NxtEnginesForward
node.description: Enables motors on the given ports with the given power. Ports are specified with A, B or C letters divided by commas. The power is specified in percents with the number from -100 to 100, if negative number is specified then the motor is enabled in the reverse mode.

node.name: TrikV6EnginesBackward
node.description: Enables motors on the given ports in reverse mode with the given power. Ports are specified in accordance with TRIK controller notations (for example M1, E2) and divided by commas. The power is specified in percents with the number from -100 to 100, if negative number is specified then the motor is enabled in the usial mode.

node.name: TrikV6EnginesForward
node.description: Enables motors on the given ports with the given power. Ports are specified in accordance with TRIK controller notations (for example M1, E2) and divided by commas. The power is specified in percents with the number from -100 to 100, if negative number is specified then the motor is enabled in the reverse mode.

node.name: TrikAngularServo
node.description: Manages angular servomotor. Sets up rotation angle on the given port in degrees. Values from 0 to 90 are correspond to a clockwise rotation and values from -90 to 0 correspond to counterclockwise rotation.

node.name: NxtEnginesStop
node.description: Disables motors on the given ports.

node.name: TrikV6EnginesStop
node.description: Disables motors on the given ports.

node.name: NxtBeep
node.description: Plays on the robot a sound with the fixed frequency. There are two parameters. The first one is a loudness of the sound, the second means if program should wait for sound completion or go to next block right away.

node.name: NxtPlayTone
node.description: Plays on the robot a sound with the given frequency and duration. This block is similar to the 'Beep' block wuth the only difference that here you can specify sound parameters.

node.name: TrikPlayTone
node.description: Plays on the robot a sound file (.wav or .mp3) previously uploaded to it.

node.name: NxtClearEncoder
node.description: Nullifies tacho limit of the motors on the given ports.

node.name: TrikV6ClearEncoder
node.description: Nullifies tacho limit of the motors on the given ports.

node.name: TrikSystem
node.description: Invokes bash script-style command on the robot.

node.name: TrikInitCamera
node.description: Enables line or object or color detector by videocamera and draws videostream on the robot`s screen.

node.name: TrikDetect
node.description: Initializes videocamera line or object or color detector with the color of the object in the middle of the camera`s sight.

node.name: TrikDetectorToVariable
node.description: Stores current videocamera line or object or color detector`s value into a given variable.

node.name: TrikLed
node.description: Sets the color of the led on the robot`s front panel.

node.name: NxtWaitForTouchSensor
node.description: Waits till the touch sensor is pressed. The only parameter is a sensor`s port number (1, 2, 3 or 4).

node.name: NxtWaitForSound
node.description: Waits till the loudness obtained by the sound sensor on the given port will be greater or lower then the given value.

node.name: NxtWaitForSonarDistance
node.description: Waits till the value returned by the ultrasonic sensor on the given port will be greater or lower then the given in the 'Distance' parameter value (the distance is specified in centimeters, 0 to 255).

node.name: NxtWaitForColorIntensity
node.description: Waits till the value returned by the color sensor on the given port will be greater or lower then the given in the 'Intensity' parameter value (the intensity is specified in percents, 0 to 100).

node.name: NxtWaitForColor
node.description: Waits till the color sensor on the given port will recognize the given color.

node.name: NxtWaitForLight
node.description: Waits till the value returned by the light sensor on the given port will be greater or lower then the given in the 'Percents' parameter value (0 to 100).

node.name: NxtWaitForEncoder
node.description: Waits till the tacho limit of the motor on the given port will reach the value of the 'Tacho Limit' parameter.

node.name: NxtWaitForEnter
node.description: Waits for \"Enter\". button press.

node.name: NxtWaitForEscape
node.description: Waits for \"Escape\" button press.

node.name: NxtWaitForLeft
node.description: Waits for \"Left\" button press.

node.name: NxtWaitForRight
node.description: Waits for \"Right\" button press.

node.name: TrikWaitForLight
node.description: Waits till the value returned by the light sensor on the given port will be greater or lower then the given in the 'Percents' parameter value (0 to 100).

node.name: TrikWaitForSonarDistance
node.description: Waits till the value returned by the ultrasonic sensor on the given port will be greater or lower then the given in the 'Distance' parameter value (the distance is specified in centimeters, 0 to 255).

node.name: TrikWaitForIRDistance
node.description: Waits till the value returned by the infrared sensor on the given port will be greater or lower then the given in the 'Distance' parameter value (the distance is specified in centimeters, 0 to 255).

node.name: TrikWaitForGyroscope
node.description: Waits till the value returned by the gyroscope on the given port will be greater or lower then the given in the 'Degrees/sec' parameter value.

node.name: TrikWaitForMotion
node.description: Waits till the motion sensor on the given port is triggered.

node.name: TrikWaitForEncoder
node.description: Waits till the tacho limit of the motor on the given port will reach the value of the 'Tacho Limit' parameter.

node.name: TrikWaitForEnter
node.description: Waits for \"Enter\". button press.

node.name: TrikWaitForLeft
node.description: Waits for \"Left\" button press.

node.name: TrikWaitForRight
node.description: Waits for \"Right\" button press.

node.name: TrikWaitForDown
node.description: Waits for \"Down\" button press.

node.name: TrikWaitForUp
node.description: Waits for \"Up\" button press.

node.name: TrikWaitForPower
node.description: Waits for \"Power\" button press.

node.name: Timer
node.description: Waits for a given time in milliseconds.

node.name: ClearScreen
node.description: Clears everything drawn on the robot`s screen.

node.name: PrintText
node.description: Prints a given line in the specified coordinates on the robot`s screen. '$' token can be used in front of the identifier for printing its value. This feature is ignored in case when backslash ('\\') is written before the '$' token. Example: '\\$a = $a' expression will print '$a = 5' if the value of the variable 'a' is 5.

node.name: NxtDrawPixel
node.description: Draws one pixel in the specified coordinates on the robot screen.

node.name: NxtDrawLine
node.description: Draws a segment on the robot screen. The parameters specify the ends of the segment.

node.name: NxtDrawRect
node.description: Draws a rectangle on the robot screen. The parameters specify the coordinates of top-left corner, the width and the height of the rectangle.

node.name: NxtDrawCircle
node.description: Draws on the robot screen a circle with the given center and radius.

node.name: TrikSetPainterColor
node.description: Sets the painter color.

node.name: TrikSetPainterWidth
node.description: Sets the painter width.

node.name: TrikDrawPixel
node.description: Draws one pixel in the specified coordinates on the robot screen.

node.name: TrikDrawLine
node.description: Draws a segment on the robot screen. The parameters specify the ends of the segment.

node.name: TrikDrawRect
node.description: Draws a rectangle on the robot screen. The parameters specify the coordinates of top-left corner, the width and the height of the rectangle.

node.name: TrikDrawEllipse
node.description: Draws the ellipse defined by the rectangle beginning at (x, y) with the given width and height.

node.name: TrikDrawArc
node.description: Draws the arc defined by the rectangle beginning at (x, y) with the specified width and height, and the given startAngle and spanAngle.

node.name: TrikSmile
node.description: Draws a smile on the robot`s screen :)

node.name: TrikSadSmile
node.description: Draws a sad smile on the robot`s screen :(

node.name: TrikSetBackground
node.description: Sets the background color of the current picture on the robot`s screen.

node.name: TrikSay
node.description: Synthesizes the given phrase and plays it on the robot.
